meanings.definition: To fall back into a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After trying to improve his grades, he refallen into old study habits.
meanings.sent2: She refallen into her old routine after the vacation ended.
meanings.sent3: The cat refallen asleep on the warm sunlit windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The town refallen into silence after the festival ended.
meanings.sent5: The leaves refallen from the tree, covering the ground in a colorful carpet.

meanings.definition: Fallen back into a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The refallen leaves crunched under our feet as we walked through the park.
meanings.sent2: The refallen snow made the roads slippery again.
meanings.sent3: The refallen cake was still delicious, even after being left out overnight.
meanings.sent4: The refallen building looked even more majestic in its aged beauty.
meanings.sent5: The refallen leaves painted a beautiful mosaic on the forest floor.
